{RW}: Red creatures and white creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: A river even the merrow dare not cross.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : When the enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, you choose the value of X, pay for it, and put the tokens onto the battlefield. You can activate mana abilities to pay for {X}, but no one can cast spells or activate abilities in response to this choice.

card.name: Riverfall Mimic
card.ability: Whenever you cast a spell that's both blue and red, Riverfall Mimic becomes 3/3 and is unblockable until end of turn.
card.flavor: Mimics don't hide their natural form well, but their disguises work well enough on boggarts.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : The ability triggers whenever you cast a spell that's both of its listed colors. It doesn't matter whether that spell also happens to be any other colors.
8/1/2008 : If you cast a spell that's the two appropriate colors for the second time in a turn, the ability triggers again. The Mimic will once again become the power and toughness stated in its ability, which could overwrite power- and toughness-setting effects that have been applied to it in the meantime.
8/1/2008 : Any other abilities the Mimic may have gained are not affected.
10/1/2009 : The effect from the ability overwrites other effects that set power and/or toughness if and only if those effects existed before the ability resolved. It will not overwrite effects that modify power or toughness (whether from a static ability, counters, or a resolved spell or ability), nor will it overwrite effects that set power and toughness which come into existence after the ability resolves. Effects that switch the creature's power and toughness are always applied after any other power or toughness changing effects, including this one, regardless of the order in which they are created.

card.name: Rugged Prairie
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{RW}, {T}: Add {R}{R}, {R}{W}, or {W}{W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Hobs bury their kin far from home. They believe the dry, open ground keeps hags from stealing the bones and gwyllions from stealing the spirits.

card.name: Sanity Grinding
card.ability: Chroma — Reveal the top ten cards of your library. For each blue mana symbol in the mana costs of the revealed cards, target opponent puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then put the cards you revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Chroma abilities check only mana costs, which are found in a card's upper right corner. They don't count mana symbols that appear in a card's text box.
8/1/2008 : Chroma abilities count hybrid mana symbols of the appropriate color. For example, a card with mana cost {3}{U/R}{U/R} has two red mana symbols in its mana cost.
8/1/2008 : If there are fewer than ten cards in your library, reveal them all. For each blue mana symbol in those cards' mana costs, the targeted opponent puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then you reorder your entire library as you choose.

card.name: Sapling of Colfenor
card.ability:
Sapling of Colfenor is indestructible.
Whenever Sapling of Colfenor attacks, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, you gain life equal to that card's toughness, lose life equal to its power, then put it into your hand.
card.flavor: Her plans may yet bear fruit.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Lethal damage and effects that say "destroy" won't cause Sapling of Colfenor to be put into the graveyard. However, Sapling of Colfenor will be put into the graveyard if its toughness becomes 0 or less, if it's sacrificed, or if another Sapling of Colfenor is on the battlefield (due to the "legend rule").
8/1/2008 : The triggered ability results in three sequential events: you gain some life (subject to effects that might alter life gain), then lose some life (subject to other effects that might alter life loss), and then put the card into your hand.
8/1/2008 : If a creature card has "*" in its power or toughness, the ability that defines "*" works in all zones. Note that the card is in your library when Sapling of Colfenor's ability checks the card's power and toughness.
8/1/2008 : If the revealed card is not a creature card, it remains on top of your library.

card.name: Savage Conception
card.ability:
Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
card.flavor: Some beasts are born not of a mother, but of magic.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Casting a card by using its retrace ability works just like casting any other card, with two exceptions: You're casting the card from your graveyard rather than your hand, and you must discard a land card in addition to any other costs.
8/1/2008 : A retrace card cast from your graveyard follows the normal timing rules for its card type.
8/1/2008 : When a retrace card you cast from your graveyard resolves or is countered, it's put back into your graveyard. You may use the retrace ability to cast it again.
8/1/2008 : If the active player casts a spell that has retrace, that player may cast that card again after it resolves, before another player can remove the card from the graveyard. The active player has priority after the spell resolves, so he or she can immediately cast a new spell. Since casting a card with retrace from the graveyard moves that card onto the stack, no one else would have the chance to affect it while it's still in the graveyard.

card.name: Scarecrone
card.ability:
{1}, Sacrifice a Scarecrow: Draw a card.
{4}, {T}: Return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: Her poppets bring joy to the truly depraved.

card.name: Scourge of the Nobilis
card.ability:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is red, it gets +1/+1 and has "{RW}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+1 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : If the enchanted creature is both of the listed colors, it will get both bonuses.
8/1/2008 : The controller of the enchanted creature, not the controller of Scourge of the Nobilis, can activate the +1/+0 ability.
8/1/2008 : Once the +1/+0 ability is activated, it exists independently of the creature and Scourge of the Nobilis. It will resolve, and the creature will retain the bonus for the rest of the turn, even if Scourge of the Nobilis stops enchanting that creature.

card.name: Selkie Hedge-Mage
card.ability:
When Selkie Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Forests, you may gain 3 life.
When Selkie Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Islands, you may return target tapped creature to its owner's hand.
card.ruling:

That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless you control two or more lands of the appropriate land type when the Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you don't control two or more lands of the appropriate land type by the time it resolves.
8/1/2008 : Both abilities trigger at the same time. You can put them on the stack in any order.
8/1/2008 : Each of the triggered abilities look at your lands individually. This means that if you only control two dual-lands of the appropriate types, both of the abilities will trigger
8/1/2008 : Both abilities are optional; you choose whether to use them when they resolve. If an ability has a target, you must choose a target even if you don't plan to use the ability.

card.name: Shell Skulkin
card.ability: {3}: Target blue creature gains shroud until end of turn.
card.flavor: Skulkins confer strange benefits on unsuspecting patrons.

card.name: Shorecrasher Mimic
card.ability: Whenever you cast a spell that's both green and blue, Shorecrasher Mimic becomes 5/3 and gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: The Aurora replaced the changelings' innocence with malice and their curiosity with hunger.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : The ability triggers whenever you cast a spell that's both of its listed colors. It doesn't matter whether that spell also happens to be any other colors.
8/1/2008 : If you cast a spell that's the two appropriate colors for the second time in a turn, the ability triggers again. The Mimic will once again become the power and toughness stated in its ability, which could overwrite power- and toughness-setting effects that have been applied to it in the meantime.
8/1/2008 : Any other abilities the Mimic may have gained are not affected.
10/1/2009 : The effect from the ability overwrites other effects that set power and/or toughness if and only if those effects existed before the ability resolved. It will not overwrite effects that modify power or toughness (whether from a static ability, counters, or a resolved spell or ability), nor will it overwrite effects that set power and toughness which come into existence after the ability resolves. Effects that switch the creature's power and toughness are always applied after any other power or toughness changing effects, including this one, regardless of the order in which they are created.

card.name: Shrewd Hatchling
card.ability:
Shrewd Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{UR}: Target creature can't block Shrewd Hatchling this turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : If you cast a spell that's both of the listed colors, both abilities will trigger. You'll remove a total of two -1/-1 counters from the Hatchling.
8/1/2008 : If there are no -1/-1 counters on it when the triggered ability resolves, the ability does nothing. There is no penalty for not being able to remove a counter.

card.name: Slippery Bogle
card.ability: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
card.flavor: Bogles are very tasty if you can get the skin off. It's getting a blade on them that's the problem.

card.name: Smoldering Butcher
card.ability: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
card.flavor: A cinder's axe bears no marks from parrying a foe's blade.

card.name: Snakeform
card.ability:
Target creature loses all abilities and becomes a 1/1 green Snake until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Losing his possessions distressed him, but the lack of limbs was strangely liberating.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Snakeform doesn't counter abilities that have already triggered or been activated. In particular, there is no way to cast this to stop a creature's "At the beginning of your upkeep" or "When this creature enters the battlefield" abilities from triggering.
8/1/2008 : If the affected creature gains an ability after Snakeform resolves, it will keep that ability.
8/1/2008 : If Snakeform affects a creature with changeling, the creature will lose its changeling ability, and will no longer be all creature types.
10/1/2009 : The power/toughness-setting effect overwrites other effects that set power and toughness only if those effects existed before this spell resolved. It will not overwrite effects that modify power or toughness (whether from a static ability, counters, or a resolved spell or ability), nor will it overwrite effects that set power and toughness which come into existence after this spell resolves. Effects that switch the creature's power and toughness are always applied after any other power or toughness changing effects, including this one, regardless of the order in which they are created.

card.name: Soot Imp
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a player casts a nonblack spell, that player loses 1 life.
card.flavor:
"If one gets in your chimney, you're going to need a long wick and a barrel of bangstuff to get it out."
—Hob Heddil
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : This ability affects all players, including you.
8/1/2008 : A hybrid spell that's black and another color is *not* a nonblack spell. Since it's black, it can't be nonblack!

card.name: Soul Reap
card.ability: Destroy target nongreen creature. Its controller loses 3 life if you've cast another black spell this turn.
card.flavor: Their thoughtweft carried Darial's last thoughts back to his doun. They sorely wished it had not.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A hybrid creature that's green and another color is *not* a nongreen creature. Since it's green, it can't be nongreen!
8/1/2008 : Soul Reap doesn't check whether you've cast another black spell until Soul Reap resolves. If you cast Soul Reap, then cast a black instant in response, the creature's controller will lose the life when Soul Reap resolves.
8/1/2008 : Although Soul Reap says it looks for "another black spell," there's no requirement that Soul Reap actually be cast (or be black) for this part of its ability to work. For example, if a spell such as Commandeer causes you to gain control of Soul Reap, it'll still check whether you cast a black spell this turn, even though you didn't cast Soul Reap itself.

card.name: Soul Snuffers
card.ability: When Soul Snuffers enters the battlefield, put a -1/-1 counter on each creature.
card.flavor: They once sought to unite with the flame of transcendence. Now they seek only to extinguish the lights of others.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : The ability puts a -1/-1 counter on Soul Snuffers, too.

card.name: Spirit of the Hearth
card.ability:
Flying
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
card.flavor: Thieves know that a snarl in the night means, "Rob another house."

card.name: Spitemare
card.ability: Whenever Spitemare is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"I knew a creature carved from a dream of wild freedom. Any attempt to leash or exploit it failed, and at terrible cost."
—Ashling
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : Even if the amount of damage dealt to Spitemare is enough to destroy it, Spitemare's ability will trigger and it will deal the full amount of damage to the target.

card.name: Spitting Image
card.ability:
Put a token that's a copy of target creature onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
card.flavor: Spitting is the customary greeting between a creature and its magical impostor.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Casting a card by using its retrace ability works just like casting any other card, with two exceptions: You're casting the card from your graveyard rather than your hand, and you must discard a land card in addition to any other costs.
8/1/2008 : A retrace card cast from your graveyard follows the normal timing rules for its card type.
8/1/2008 : When a retrace card you cast from your graveyard resolves or is countered, it's put back into your graveyard. You may use the retrace ability to cast it again.
8/1/2008 : If the active player casts a spell that has retrace, that player may cast that card again after it resolves, before another player can remove the card from the graveyard. The active player has priority after the spell resolves, so he or she can immediately cast a new spell. Since casting a card with retrace from the graveyard moves that card onto the stack, no one else would have the chance to affect it while it's still in the graveyard.
8/1/2008 : As the token is created, it checks the printed values of the creature it's copying -- or, if that creature is itself a token, the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield -- as well as any copy effects that have been applied to it. It won't copy counters on the creature, nor will it copy other effects that have changed the creature's power, toughness, types, color, or so on.

card.name: Springjack Pasture
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{4}, {T}: Put a 0/1 white Goat creature token onto the battlefield.
{T}, Sacrifice X Goats: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool. You gain X life.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Springjack Pasture's last ability is a mana ability. The whole ability -- including the life gain -- doesn't use the stack and therefore can't be responded to.
8/1/2008 : If you sacrifice no Goats, you'll add no mana to your mana pool and you'll gain no life.
8/1/2008 : You can sacrifice any Goats you control to activate the third ability, not just Goats created by Springjack Pasture.

card.name: Springjack Shepherd
card.ability: Chroma — When Springjack Shepherd enters the battlefield, put a 0/1 white Goat creature token onto the battlefield for each white mana symbol in the mana costs of permanents you control.
card.flavor: "Better for a doun to lose its cenn than its springjacks."
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Chroma abilities check only mana costs, which are found in a card's upper right corner. They don't count mana symbols that appear in a card's text box.
8/1/2008 : Chroma abilities count hybrid mana symbols of the appropriate color. For example, a card with mana cost {3}{U/R}{U/R} has two red mana symbols in its mana cost.
8/1/2008 : The effect counts the mana symbols in this cards mana cost as well.

card.name: Stalker Hag
card.ability: Swampwalk, forestwalk
card.flavor: Her hunt is silent until a bone snaps or flesh tears. Her victims never know to scream.

card.name: Stigma Lasher
card.ability:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever Stigma Lasher deals damage to a player, that player can't gain life for the rest of the game.
card.flavor: The Extinguisher's curse lasted long after her departure.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Once the last ability resolves, it will be in effect for the rest of the game. It doesn't matter if Stigma Lasher remains on the battlefield or not.
8/1/2008 : If a player has been dealt damage by Stigma Lasher, the following things are true: -- Spells and abilities that would normally cause that player to gain life still resolve, but the life-gain part simply has no effect. -- If a cost includes having that player gain life (like Invigorate's alternative cost does), that cost can't be paid. -- Effects that would replace having that player gain life with some other effect won't be able to do anything because it's impossible for that player to gain life. -- Effects that replace an event with having that player gain life (like Words of Worship's effect does) will end up replacing the event with nothing. -- If an effect says to set that player's life total to a certain number, and that number is higher than the player's current life total, that part of the effect won't do anything. (If the number is lower than that player's current life total, the effect will work as normal.)

card.name: Stillmoon Cavalier
card.ability:
Protection from white and from black
{WB}: Stillmoon Cavalier gains flying until end of turn.
{WB}: Stillmoon Cavalier gains first strike until end of turn.
{WB}{WB}: Stillmoon Cavalier gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Stream Hopper
card.ability: {UR}: Stream Hopper gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Like many who dwell in Shadowmoor now, he was robbed of his better half by the Aurora.

card.name: Sturdy Hatchling
card.ability:
Sturdy Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{GU}: Sturdy Hatchling gains shroud until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a green spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Sturdy Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Sturdy Hatchling.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : If you cast a spell that's both of the listed colors, both abilities will trigger. You'll remove a total of two -1/-1 counters from the Hatchling.
8/1/2008 : If there are no -1/-1 counters on it when the triggered ability resolves, the ability does nothing. There is no penalty for not being able to remove a counter.

card.name: Suture Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
{WB}{WB}{WB}: Regenerate target creature.
card.flavor: Is her need to heal born out of compassion or penance?

card.name: Swirling Spriggan
card.ability: {GU}{GU}: Target creature you control becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: After its encounter with the spriggan, the patrol was red with anger, green with envy, white with fear, and painfully black and blue.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : You can choose any color or combination of colors. You can't choose colorless.

card.name: Syphon Life
card.ability:
Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
card.flavor: Leeches never tire of feeding.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Casting a card by using its retrace ability works just like casting any other card, with two exceptions: You're casting the card from your graveyard rather than your hand, and you must discard a land card in addition to any other costs.
8/1/2008 : A retrace card cast from your graveyard follows the normal timing rules for its card type.
8/1/2008 : When a retrace card you cast from your graveyard resolves or is countered, it's put back into your graveyard. You may use the retrace ability to cast it again.
8/1/2008 : If the active player casts a spell that has retrace, that player may cast that card again after it resolves, before another player can remove the card from the graveyard. The active player has priority after the spell resolves, so he or she can immediately cast a new spell. Since casting a card with retrace from the graveyard moves that card onto the stack, no one else would have the chance to affect it while it's still in the graveyard.

card.name: Talara's Bane
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a green or white creature card from it. You gain life equal that creature card's toughness, then that player discards that card.
card.flavor:
"Your thoughts betray you."
—Illulia of Nighthearth
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : If the creature card has "*" in its power or toughness, the ability that defines "*" works in all zones. Note that the card is in the opponent's hand when Talara's Bane checks its toughness.

card.name: Talara's Battalion
card.ability:
Trample
Cast Talara's Battalion only if you've cast another green spell this turn.
card.flavor: The safewright Talara protects a delicate woodland waterfall. She has vowed to send wave after wave of warriors to slay any who would dare disturb its beauty.

card.name: Talonrend
card.ability:
Flying
{UR}: Talonrend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Change is a denizen of Shadowmoor as much as ouphes and noggles are.

card.name: Thunderblust
card.ability:
Haste
Thunderblust has trample as long as it has a -1/-1 counter on it.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

card.name: Tilling Treefolk
card.ability: When Tilling Treefolk enters the battlefield, you may return up to two target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: He digs his roots into barren ground, searching for old seeds that never had the chance to sprout.

card.name: Trapjaw Kelpie
card.ability:
Flash
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: Travelers in these waters leave a bit of themselves behind.

card.name: Twilight Mire
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{BG}, {T}: Add {B}{B}, {B}{G}, or {G}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: As their roots soaked in a weak tea of bogwater and decay, the trees absorbed the essence of death into their living tissue.

card.name: Twinblade Slasher
card.ability:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{1}{G}: Twinblade Slasher gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: Righteous anger hones a humble soul.

card.name: Umbra Stalker
card.ability: Chroma — Umbra Stalker's power and toughness are each equal to the number of black mana symbols in the mana costs of cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Don't venture into the darkness, lest it decide not to let you leave.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : This is a characteristic-defining ability, which means it functions in all zones. You include the symbols in the Stalker's own mana cost if you need to determine its power and/or toughness while it's in the graveyard.
8/1/2008 : Chroma abilities check only mana costs, which are found in a card's upper right corner. They don't count mana symbols that appear in a card's text box.
8/1/2008 : Chroma abilities count hybrid mana symbols of the appropriate color. For example, a card with mana cost {3}{U/R}{U/R} has two red mana symbols in its mana cost.

card.name: Unmake
card.ability: Exile target creature.
card.flavor: A gwyllion's favorite trap is the vanity mirror. A bewitched piece of glass traps the looker's soul and does away with the body.

card.name: Unnerving Assault
card.ability: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-0 until end of turn if {U} was spent to cast Unnerving Assault, and creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn if {R} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {U}{R} was spent.)
card.flavor: The scales of battle rarely balance.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : The spell cares about what mana was spent to pay its total cost, not just what mana was spent to pay the hybrid part of its cost.
8/1/2008 : The spell checks on resolution to see if any mana of the stated colors was spent to pay its cost. If so, it doesn't matter how much mana of that color was spent.
8/1/2008 : If the spell is copied, the copy will never have had mana of the stated color paid for it, no matter what colors were spent on the original spell.
8/1/2008 : Unnerving Assault affects only creatures on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If a creature enters the battlefield later that turn, it won't be affected.
8/1/2008 : If a creature changes controllers later in the turn, that won't change how Unnerving Assault affected it.

card.name: Unwilling Recruit
card.ability: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gets +X/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: Frorn didn't want to be kept, but he didn't want to be thrown back either.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : You may target a creature you already control with Unwilling Recruit. If you do, you'll gain control of that creature (which usually won't have any visible effect), untap it, and it'll get +X/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Voracious Hatchling
card.ability:
Lifelink
Voracious Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
Whenever you cast a white spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Voracious Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a black spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Voracious Hatchling.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : If you cast a spell that's both of the listed colors, both abilities will trigger. You'll remove a total of two -1/-1 counters from the Hatchling.
8/1/2008 : If there are no -1/-1 counters on it when the triggered ability resolves, the ability does nothing. There is no penalty for not being able to remove a counter.

card.name: Wake Thrasher
card.ability: Whenever a permanent you control becomes untapped, Wake Thrasher gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Anyone who thinks merrows have more brains than brawn has never been run over by one.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : If permanents you control become untapped during your untap step, Wake Thresher's ability will trigger that many times. However, since no player gets priority during the untap step, those abilities wait to be put on the stack until your upkeep starts. At that time, all your "beginning of upkeep" triggers will also trigger. You can put them and Wake Thresher's abilities on the stack in any order.

card.name: Ward of Bones
card.ability: Each opponent who controls more creatures than you can't play creature cards. The same is true for artifacts, enchantments, and lands.
card.flavor: Mages dare not attempt magic in its grotesque presence.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : Spelling this out completely: -- Each opponent who controls more creatures than you can't play creature cards. -- Each opponent who controls more artifacts than you can't play artifact cards. -- Each opponent who controls more enchantments than you can't play enchantment cards. -- Each opponent who controls more lands than you can't play land cards.

card.name: Waves of Aggression
card.ability:
Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Casting a card by using its retrace ability works just like casting any other card, with two exceptions: You're casting the card from your graveyard rather than your hand, and you must discard a land card in addition to any other costs.
8/1/2008 : A retrace card cast from your graveyard follows the normal timing rules for its card type.
8/1/2008 : When a retrace card you cast from your graveyard resolves or is countered, it's put back into your graveyard. You may use the retrace ability to cast it again.
8/1/2008 : If the active player casts a spell that has retrace, that player may cast that card again after it resolves, before another player can remove the card from the graveyard. The active player has priority after the spell resolves, so he or she can immediately cast a new spell. Since casting a card with retrace from the graveyard moves that card onto the stack, no one else would have the chance to affect it while it's still in the graveyard.
8/1/2008 : Waves of Aggression untaps all creatures that attacked this turn, not just those that attacked during the most recent combat phase.
8/1/2008 : If it's somehow not a main phase when Waves of Aggression resolves, all it does is untap all creatures that attacked that turn. No new phases are created.

card.name: Wickerbough Elder
card.ability:
Wickerbough Elder enters the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it.
{G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from Wickerbough Elder: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: "Living scarecrows make a mockery of the natural order. Dead ones make fine hats."

card.name: Wilderness Hypnotist
card.ability: {T}: Target red or green creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I felt as if I were moving in brackish water, as if I were drowning, even though I knew I stood on dry land."
—Dindun of Kulrath Mine

card.name: Wistful Selkie
card.ability: When Wistful Selkie enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: Selkies call to a sea they never swam, in a tongue they never spoke, with a song they never learned.

card.name: Woodlurker Mimic
card.ability: Whenever you cast a spell that's both black and green, Woodlurker Mimic becomes 4/5 and gains wither until end of turn. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
card.flavor: A mimic's disguise fools its victims just long enough to draw them within range of its venomous tentacles.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : The ability triggers whenever you cast a spell that's both of its listed colors. It doesn't matter whether that spell also happens to be any other colors.
8/1/2008 : If you cast a spell that's the two appropriate colors for the second time in a turn, the ability triggers again. The Mimic will once again become the power and toughness stated in its ability, which could overwrite power- and toughness-setting effects that have been applied to it in the meantime.
8/1/2008 : Any other abilities the Mimic may have gained are not affected.
10/1/2009 : The effect from the ability overwrites other effects that set power and/or toughness if and only if those effects existed before the ability resolved. It will not overwrite effects that modify power or toughness (whether from a static ability, counters, or a resolved spell or ability), nor will it overwrite effects that set power and toughness which come into existence after the ability resolves. Effects that switch the creature's power and toughness are always applied after any other power or toughness changing effects, including this one, regardless of the order in which they are created.

card.name: Worm Harvest
card.ability:
Put a 1/1 black and green Worm creature token onto the battlefield for each land card in your graveyard.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Casting a card by using its retrace ability works just like casting any other card, with two exceptions: You're casting the card from your graveyard rather than your hand, and you must discard a land card in addition to any other costs.
8/1/2008 : A retrace card cast from your graveyard follows the normal timing rules for its card type.
8/1/2008 : When a retrace card you cast from your graveyard resolves or is countered, it's put back into your graveyard. You may use the retrace ability to cast it again.
8/1/2008 : If the active player casts a spell that has retrace, that player may cast that card again after it resolves, before another player can remove the card from the graveyard. The active player has priority after the spell resolves, so he or she can immediately cast a new spell. Since casting a card with retrace from the graveyard moves that card onto the stack, no one else would have the chance to affect it while it's still in the graveyard.
8/1/2008 : If you cast Worm Harvest from your graveyard by using retrace, the land you discard as an additional cost will be counted by Worm Harvest when it resolves.
